thread.title: Women’s soccer: Whitworth plays to 1-all draw with Linfield - Sat, 24 Oct 2015 PST
thread.title_full: Women’s soccer: Whitworth plays to 1-all draw with Linfield - Sat, 24 Oct 2015 PST

title: Women’s soccer: Whitworth plays to 1-all draw with Linfield - Sat, 24 Oct 2015 PST
text:
Courtney Potter scored her first goal of the season in the 55th minute and Whitworth played to a 1-all draw with Linfield in a Northwest Athletic Conference match Saturday in Spokane. 
Emma Vukic scored an unassisted goal in the 30th minute for the Wildcats (8-4-2, 5-4-2). 
The Pirates (6-8-2, 4-6-2 … 
Courtney Potter scored her first goal of the season in the 55th minute and Whitworth played to a 1-all draw with Linfield in a Northwest Athletic Conference match Saturday in Spokane. 
Emma Vukic scored an unassisted goal in the 30th minute for the Wildcats (8-4-2, 5-4-2). 
The Pirates (6-8-2, 4-6-2) host Willamette on Sunday. Lowery guides North Idaho to victory 
Meg Lowery scored twice to lead North Idaho past Walla Walla 5-1 in a Northwest Athletic Conference match in Walla Walla. 
Emily Aspden, Corinne Ariss and Jessica Scott all added goals for the Cardinals, who held a 16-9 shot advantage over the Warriors (5-7-3, 4-5-1). 
It was the fourth straight win for NIC (9-4-2, 7-2-1), which will play Community Colleges of Spokane Wednesday at Spokane Falls Community College in a battle for first place in the NWAC’s east division. Taylor’s goal lifts Treasure Valley past CCS 
Madison Taylor’s 20th-minute goal held up and Treasure Valley (10-6-1, 6-3-1) edged Community Colleges of Spokane 1-0 in an NWAC match in Ontario, Oregon. 
Sasquatch (11-2-1, 8-2) keeper Emily Busselman made five saves.
